description: From German Zirkon, possibly via French zircon, formed in the 1780s from Arabic زَرْقُون‎ (zarqūn). Doublet of jargoon.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A mineral occurring in tetragonal crystals, usually of a brown or grey colour and consisting of silica and zirconia.
(countable) A crystal of zircon, sometimes used as a false gemstone.
